Based on your interest in the Filipino language and 1935, I'd like to recommend "Tortilla Flat" (1935). This classic film tells the story of Danny, a poor northern Californian Mexican-American who inherits two houses from his grandfather, only to be taken advantage of by his vagabond friends. With its charming cast of characters and light-hearted tone, I think you'll find it an enjoyable companion piece to We the Living.

If you're in the mood for something a bit more adventurous, "Find Me Guilty" (2006) might be up your alley! This courtroom drama follows Jackie DiNorscio as he defends himself in what becomes the longest criminal trial in American judicial history. With its impressive cast of characters and unpredictable plot twists, I think you'll find it a thrilling ride.

This classic war drama follows a US Army officer on a perilous mission to assassinate a renegade colonel in Cambodia during the Vietnam War.
